website_summaries.verdict: Misfit's tube-shaped Ray fitness tracker looks stylish and gets the job done, but it does too little for what it costs.
pros: Slim design, water-resistant, long battery life thanks to replaceable batteries
cons: Uncomfortable fit won't feel great on all wrists
Minimal look means no buttons or display, except for one glowing light
Misfit app not as good as competing fitness apps

customer_reviews.title: I REALLY liked this little device...but QUITE disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: After 4 battery changes (yes, about every 3 months), it died because the O-ring no longer seals. It's a simple no frill device, no screen to scratch, and has all the functions i wanted (waterproof, changeable battery, message notifications even though it's inconsistent, and vibrating alarm. Unfortunately, the software is still immature. The battery status is ALWAYS "Full". the only way to know the battery is out is when the band won't sync. I bought this on march 5, 2017. the band was replaced once under warranty because it no longer sync. no reason provided by tech support that i can remember. the second band finally died a few days ago right after the 4th battery change from water leakage.
customer_reviews.author: KimOrDave Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great Product with Outstanding Customer Service!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Mifit Ray as a replacement for a Fitbit that I couldn't get to work and I'm glad I did. The Ray looks great, and does everything it's supposed to do. Measures my exercise accurately, and my sleep as well. More importantly to me, I contacted their customer service department about a broken clasp, they were very polite, and extremely responsive, replacing it no charge very quickly. I also asked about a syncing issue, responded in a timely manner again. Very very happy.
customer_reviews.author: R. Beno

customer_reviews.title: Like it so far...
customer_reviews.text: I had a jawbone up2 before this, which I liked, until the strap disintegrated. The first thing I noticed about the ray is that the band was not only durable, but also interchangeable. I also love that it alerts me to when someone texts or calls me- especially since I am never by my phone, or have it on silent for work. The only thing I am disappointed in, so far, is the app. It seems that Jawbone has more of a user friendly app, and is more customizable in terms of tracking workouts and syncing to other apps/devices.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Misfit should be more popular
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why I don't see more people wearing Misfit trackers, especially the Ray. It looks like jewelry, not the "Look at my fitness tracker" dorky look of other trackers. It tracks sleep very well, runs for a long time on batteries so it doesn't require nightly or weekly charging. It's not super accurate, but what tracker at this price is? It's accurate enough, and the Misfit app is solid for those who want basic information. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and classy activity tracker
customer_reviews.text: Great activity tracker and the ability to replace batteries is handy. I've worn mine for 3+ months without and have yet to replace the batteries. Waterproof and stylish, with other band options/colors available. The app its sleek, but some customization options would be nice. Sleep tracking is convenient unless working night shifts, does not track sleep during daylight hours.
customer_reviews.author: Codesseus

customer_reviews.title: Was good... until it stopped working...
customer_reviews.text: When I first got it, I loved it! It’s super basi and easy. Just wear it and forget it. But I have now replaced the batteries for the 3rd time in 4 months! The product claims the batteries should last 6 months. Also, since I have replaced the batteries, I don’t think the tracking is working properly, and the just slow flashes rainbow colors at random points in the day, even in the middle of the night. For something I paid $70, I expect to be able to use it for more than 4 months with out if malfuntioning....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The recommended fixes haven't worked
customer_reviews.text: In the five weeks I've had my Misfit Ray, it has failed to sync three times. The recommended fixes haven't worked, so I've had to reset the device. The trouble with doing that is you lose all the data since the last sync. For me, incomplete data takes the fun out of tracking my activity because it means I don't have a record of meeting my goal. Also, it prevents me from monitoring my sleep. When the product works, it's great. Its lack of reliability makes it a very unsatisfactory product.
customer_reviews.author: john lutter

customer_reviews.title: Tracking sleep when I'm not wearing it....
customer_reviews.text: I took my misfit off around 6pm one evening and put it back on shortly before bed. It registered the hours I wasn't wearing it as sleep. According to the website it has a special algorithm to calculate sleep patterns but apparently it can't tell when it's not being worn at all. It also vibrates at random times during the day - not the reminder to be active and also not a notification since I have those turned off. It's comfortable to wear and a good solution if you don't want a watch, I'm just questioning some of the functionality here.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: A nice elegant fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I’m really happy with my purchase. It’s much more attractive than other fitness trackers, and is a great choice for people with small wrists since it’s not nearly as bulky as other options. The fitness tracking seems to work pretty well, but the sleep tracking isn’t as accurate unfortunately. Overall, would still recommend. This color combination in particular is really nice, and perfect for daily wear.
customer_reviews.author: h.

customer_reviews.title: This product didn't do a good job of counting steps
customer_reviews.text: Here's my pros and cons. Cons:This product didn't do a good job of counting steps. I didn't like the app either. It has a point system which I never saw before. It also lacks in design. It looks like an item you would buy at an art fair from a person you might feel sorry for. Pros:I saw that it was water proof, but didn't test it. It is unattractive, but does fit on wrists that are smaller. Some of the fitbits are too big for ladies with thin wrists.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Works great. The apps (Misfit & Link) are very easy ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Misfit product (I had a Flash that I used for 2 years until one of my 4-legged patients somehow managed to 'tooth' the face of it - BTW, I'm a vet tech). I've been wearing the Ray since I got it. Works great. The apps (Misfit & Link) are very easy to use. I have a Bolt lightbulb that I have connected to my Ray as well. I get complements everywhere I go - it's quite stylish and can be easily dressed up.
customer_reviews.author: Pretty.In.Ink

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% accurate but i like it
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't buy again. I like it, good price, sleek, no hassle to wear but it doesn't work great. It tells me to move after an hour of non movement but i moved seconds before. It does sinc with phone and notify me of text, call etc. I love this feature. I had issue with 1st battery software, misfit sent a new one. That was nice. But it isn't 100% accurate... if that matters to to you
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Kessler

customer_reviews.title: Received package with dead batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Just received this today. It came with the batteries already installed and dead, batteries were not in the spot in the package. Probably used before. Upset I spent this much money on a device that I cannot even use yet until I buy more batteries. Will update this review if it works with new batteries. Until then I am VERY disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Feathers

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I like that it looks nicer than my ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I like that it looks nicer than my old Fitbit. I also like that I 'm not breaking out in a rash from a cheap non-leather band or having to charge it every three days. I'm so GLAD I bought a MIsfit. I take it off to shower since I don't want to wear the leather in the water. I'm looking forward to wearing this at the pool when I chase my little boys around this summer. It tracks steps pretty well. I'm wondering if my other system was over generous.
customer_reviews.author: Heather J. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: I had great hopes for this as I do not like the ...
customer_reviews.text: I had great hopes for this as I do not like the look of most wearables, but the product itself is a letdown. I read the reviews about how hard it is to change the band, and was too optimistic. Believe the reviews - changing the bands is very difficult. I wanted to like this product, but had to give up in frustration. There is nothing easy about set up. I didn't even bother trying with the batteries. Save yourself the time and postage.
customer_reviews.author: K. Spiess

customer_reviews.title: Batteries Got Stuck Inside
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY wanted to love the ray, but I didn't even get a chance to wear it once. I tried putting the batteries in to active it and they got lodged inside and I couldn't take them out to fix it. After two hours of trying to un-lodge them, I researched it and found out that there are hundreds of other people who also had the same issue and couldn't get them out. I'm really sad that they have a design flaw as silly as this. I ended up getting a fitbit in the end because I didn't want to risk it happening again :/
customer_reviews.author: Emily Lisanti

customer_reviews.title: Nice stylish bracelet, but not a good fitness tracker.
customer_reviews.text: My wife got a lot of compliments on the style of this (she liked how it looked with her watch), but it is absolutely useless as a fitness tracker, so she returned it. 30 minutes of intense running would count as 60 calories burned, and there is no way to adjust the activities to put in your own information. Sleep stats were way off as well (it would say she was in deep sleep when she was actually getting up throughout the night). This ended up being just a very expensive bracelet. She bought the Fitbit Flex 2 as it is a similar style and is liking it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Good product, works as advertised, has replaceable batteries so I don't have to charge it weekly or daily and when they die after 9 months I just put new ones in rather than throwing it away like I had to do with two different Fitbits. Plus it doesn't look weird wearing it with the watch my wife gave me for our anniversary several years ago.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Gentry Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Priced right
customer_reviews.text: I like the weight and looks of the rose gold misfit and it’s weightless on my wrist. It keeps track of my steps okay however I believe it takes awhile to catch up. If I were to need another tracker I believe I would stick with the more reliable Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Sylvester

customer_reviews.title: A fitness tracker that doesnt look like a fitness tracker.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Ray for about 4 years and gone through half a dozen straps over that time, so my only complaint is that the straps wear out quicker than they should. The unit itself is a good looking and I wear it at work, playing sports, casually around the house, etc. Its a nice compliment to about anything and doesnt look weird or inappropriate, regardless of how you are dressed. I bought this one knowing that they are not making new ones and that my current unit wont last forever. Hoping to wear one of these for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: but it does a great job. The styling is great
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this is expensive for the basic functions of offers, but it does a great job. The styling is great, and I don't even know I'm wearing it. The use of batteries is a real win too. How can a person track fitness when the device is on the charger. I tried my wife's jawbone, and my daughters Garmin. They each promise more, but as with anything the more things that something says it can do, the less are done well. Both were more something you needed to get used to wearing and if you have a nice watch or jewelry you like, it would need to be worn on the other wrist. Buying this was was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: 7 Months and it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Right from the beginning there were constant issues connecting via Bluetooth and syncing with the app. Overall step tracking was not bad but sleep tracking was off by 1-3 hours a night. Plus it does look nicer than most fitness trackers. HOWEVER 7 months in and it stopped working. Changed the batteries and nothing. I would not recommend buying the Misfit Ray.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Bought 3 and I think I may but more.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using those for 5 years almost. Although I have and tried several smartwatches I still go back to misfit ray as I really can wear it with my Rolex or any other non-smartwatch. The devices itself looks very nice and elegant for any casual or formal dresses. So you can wear it without being asked why you are wearing two watches especially when you wear your automatic watch. All in all, it worth the money for me although it's not the most accurate tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Saleh Ali Al Awdhi

customer_reviews.title: It's subtle and doesn't look anything like a fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: Is it sleek? Definitely. It's subtle and doesn't look anything like a fitness tracker. My big issue with the Ray is that it didn't actually track my workouts or steps accurately. I do hot yoga 4-5 times a week and it couldn't recognize those workouts despite my moving around immensely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy - spring for a real FitBit item!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this - junk. I’ve had it only 6 months and it stopped working! Won’t synch, ‘light’ on the bracelet doesn’t laminate so I know the unit it working/tracking. I took it apart to see if there was anything inside that caused it to stop working (maybe water - even though I remove it to shower/bathe!) and now it won’t go back together!!
customer_reviews.author: Maureen E. Gilchrist

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: had my first misfit shine for over 3 years never took it off wore in the pool, spa shower beach then it feel off and i couldnt find it so i bought another one this misfit ray i like the design much better as it does not have the ability to pop out keep up the great product at a great value
customer_reviews.author: kathy

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could return...
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit and the app on my phone BUT it doesn't accurately track my activities and the lights regularly flash for no apparent reason. I walked a mile with my wife and her tracker. Her's said 1 mile, mine .6. Great low overhead concept, just wish it actually tracked accurately. I would return, but missed the Amazon window. misfit site only takes returns bought through them and only if you didn't wear it... what -- how would you know??
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Nice bracelet
customer_reviews.text: I like the light weight they misfit Ray. I hardly feel like it is is on. I like that it is waterproof. The vibration is not strong enough and I was very disappointed about that so I don’t feel the alter often. It will light up for notifications. I tried the alarm once it doesn’t long enough and it did not feel.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia A Dorfman

customer_reviews.title: Good tracker & really cute
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing this a week and I love it. Set up was quick - just put in the batteries and download the app. It's been working great so far, and I really like the way it looks. I don't care that there isn't a display since I mainly track steps and I can see the number on my phone at any time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sync Suck
customer_reviews.text: I'm about two seconds away from sending this back. Does it look good? Yes. Does it track as well as the Misfit Flash. Well, I think so. It will not sync with my phone unless I power down my phone and restart it. Like EVERY time I want to sync. I don't have the time for that nonsense. Either this gets fixed by tomorrow or back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Smith

customer_reviews.title: Can't even load the batteries!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am very very disappointed so far. My misfit ray arrived today. I immediately opened the package and attempted to load the batteries. One battery became lodged in the device and it will not budge. I hate to have spent this amount of money on something that I can't even load the batteries into.
customer_reviews.author: lil_Jess87

customer_reviews.title: Not awful, but not great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this, in part, because it’s less bulky than many other similar products. It seems to be fine tracking my steps, but it does not track sleep well. It will often show me going to sleep several hours after I actually went to sleep, waking up hours before I actually wake. My other issue with the Ray is that it doesn’t always sync, so I have to unpair it from my phone, reboot the phone, and generally spend significant time trying to figure out how to get it working again.
customer_reviews.author: Jean T.

customer_reviews.title: Love the design and it does it’s job
customer_reviews.text: Love the design. Simple and no daily charging needed. Quite accurate in measuring my sleep and activity. The only thing is that it sometimes failed to sense my tapping and therefore gave no signal. Repeated tapping is then needed.
customer_reviews.author: GrassChi

customer_reviews.title: More than impressed!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! The sleep tracking and fitness tracking are amazing! The "points" system and the social aspect, especially the "Miss. Fit" who represents the average user from misfit... incredible. Super motivating. I'm excited for the vapor to come out! I'm super interested!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Better than my Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had this for very long but I have absolutely no regrets. The point system takes some getting used to but it's a minor thing. I love that I don't have to charge it every few days and no need to activate anything for sleep tracking. I have also been through about 3-4 Fitbit trackers over the past 1.5 years because they have stopped working/charging/holding a charge. The Ray also looks much nicer and doesn't come off like the Fitbit bands. Absolutely no regrets with my Ray!
customer_reviews.author: TaniaIdes10

customer_reviews.title: I wanted this one to Be The One
customer_reviews.text: Well, I wanted this one to be The One that lasted. Sadly, it wasn’t to be. After the initial battery change it has been downhill since then. I’ve rebooted the Bluetooth, changed the batteries a minimum of six times to no avail. Now it won’t track my steps accurately and it won’t record my sleep at all. I’ve had this misfit for 14 months.
customer_reviews.author: Kaalua

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love it. Traded in my Fitbit for this Ray device and I love it. I do a lot of water exercises and this is perfect. Lots of people say they like my "bracelet" it is that pretty! The sleep cycle is terrific and the ability to "edit" things allows me to track everything very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mary L

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life Bummer
customer_reviews.text: My Misfit Ray arrived a little over a month ago and I wanted to give it a few weeks or so before writing a review. It had been great up until today...the battery percentage has been showing 100% and has now all of a sudden plummeted very low and the device will now not sync with my phone or light up at all. Such a bummer. The main reason I bought the Misfit Ray was because of the battery life feature. I was loving it so much and am now so disappointed. I'm hoping these were just crummy batteries, but that also sucks that something that states it comes is sent with sub-par or old batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Motivator - BUT it stopped working suddenly !!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's simple , but does the job . It motivates me to workout more I love the option when it vibrates to remind you that you have been sitting too long . You can track your sleeping hours through the Misfit. I like the fact that it works on batteries ( changeable every 6 months ) instead of recharging it everyday. ...... ...... ...... ...... I have already written a feedback earlier. I was so happy with it , then suddenly after just almost 3 month, it stopped working !!!!
customer_reviews.author: DARA

customer_reviews.title: Great if you only want to track fitness for 5 months
customer_reviews.text: This worked great until I had to change the battery and then nothing would sync again. I gave up and bought another one and it would never sync because I had the other one. Customer service no help whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Matt Callan

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love it!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love it. I have the shine2 (and love it) and was really excited to get the Ray. Unfortunately it only sync up to my app for 3 weeks. Now nothing. Also seems it's tracking is way off... a trail I take that is 6 miles, only registered as 2 with Ray. Super bummed. Design is beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: mytwoscents

customer_reviews.title: I like the look
customer_reviews.text: I like the look. The steps are consistently about 1500 lower than the app on my phone. It only tracks sleep if you sleep at night or remember to login that you're going to bed before you sleep. It a worthless feature because I work night shift and sleep during the day. I wish I hadn't spent money on this tracker.
customer_reviews.author: lauren r.

customer_reviews.title: Great! So much better than my Fitbit one
customer_reviews.text: Great! So much better than my Fitbit one. I've washed it twice and have gone through countless holders since the end like to fall off and poke you. I never take my misfit off and it looks nice with other bracelets. I shower and do everything with it on. Very accurate with sleep and steps!
customer_reviews.author: Coryn

customer_reviews.title: Sleek but not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I like the look. It looks like a bracelet so that's a plus. However, it does not accurately track steps. I lose about 2-3 K steps on this tracker. My phone picks up more steps and I don't always have my phone on me but wear the Misfit Ray all day.. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tracker!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this tracker. Not only does it track sleep and activity but it can be linked to a calorie-counting app such as myfitnesspal. The design is minimal and the sport band is comfortable. I definitely recommend this tracker to anyone on the fence about purchasing a fitness tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Kacy

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Inaccurate and stops working after short time. Zero stars.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for about 2 months. It's definitely not as accurate as other trackers I've used in the past (wore this item and another tracker for the day. It counted maybe 50% of my steps around the house). It was ok since I liked that it's band didn't get caught on my sleeves like a lot of the other trackers with silicone bands. However, it completely stopped working about 45 days after getting it. So disappointed. Also, the seller closed the return window so I can't return it I guess. Grrr.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Preferred the Shine.
customer_reviews.text: It is ok. I miss my shine, being able to tell time and see progress was great. It doesn't seem as accurate at activity or sleep tracking (not catching my trips to get water or go to the bathroom as waking, not registering swimming). The vibration alerts are nice, and it is definitely more secure, but it is more brown than black and mostly makes me wish I had just bought another shine after I lost my first one.
customer_reviews.author: HMacB

customer_reviews.title: I'm a triathlete and I don't use this to track ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a triathlete and I don't use this to track my workouts, but I do use it to track my sleep since that's a very important element of training.
customer_reviews.author: M. Acosta

customer_reviews.title: This misfit causes sleepless nights.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked it until the sleep tracking broke, out of return window... Before then it was great. Doesn't look like a tracker and is h2o resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Sir SleepsNot

customer_reviews.title: The sad part is I love the misfit but I am ...
customer_reviews.text: Had my misfit for about a year when I noticed the batteries would not last. I decided to reach out to customer service and see if I could get help. On top of using a battery size that is not offer everywhere I was told that I need to use a certain brand of battery. Dropped the misfit and went with other brand tracker altogether. The sad part is I love the misfit but I am not spending my time looking for everywhere for the correct batteries every month.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service at its best
customer_reviews.text: I love this misfit and get loads of compliments on its style. It does a great job tracking my acitivities and sleep. I also recently had the ray stop working after just a few months and the customer service was fantastic and replaced it immediatly I was back up and running in just a day . Great product and company . Ginnie from Customer Service rocks
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Jo

customer_reviews.title: Subtle jewelry look yet great fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great product if you want something that looks like jewelry and still tracks steps and sleep. Not adequate for notifications because it lacks a screen, but is beautiful for its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Value Conscious

customer_reviews.title: Excellent support
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Misfit Ray about a month ago and I have absolutely loved it. Unfortunately, it started malfunctioning so I sent Misfit an email stating the problem. They were very quick to respond and in 4 days, I had a brand new Misfit. Even though the first one broke, I am still content with their customer support on the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality. Does what it says it does.
customer_reviews.text: While it does what it says it does, and so far has proved pretty much scratch proof, sleeping outside the window you set in the app does not get tracked. I disliked the notifications at first, as the only one I wanted was text alerts and those cannot be set to a green indicator light. . . But I adjusted.
customer_reviews.author: Roan Arkright

customer_reviews.title: Misfit fits me!
customer_reviews.text: Value priced fitness tracker that holds up in the water. I have had a Fitbit flex for a couple of years and got tired of recharging it and replacing the bands every 4 months or so. It looks more like a piece of jewelry and tracks when in airplane mode when we are are on cruises (the Flex did not). The software was easy to install and get up and running.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Second misfit product
customer_reviews.text: I really like the ray. I previously owned the misfit shine and hated how it fell out of the strap all the time but like the concept of simplicity and not having to charge. The ray stays connected to the strap and looks good. It seems accurate enough for me and I like the link app that you can setup.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: it seems to track pretty well during my dancing and walking exercises
customer_reviews.text: i haven't had to change the battery yet and i've had this for little over a month now. it seems to track pretty well during my dancing and walking exercises. i won't be swimming with it so i don't know how that is but i've accidentally worn it in the shower once or twice and so far nothing hurt it. the batteries are a little confusing to get in at times
customer_reviews.author: Chrystal

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a replacement and I really like much better than my old fitbit
customer_reviews.text: Had a fitbit which had constant sync issues and popped off and disappeared while on a crowded train. Bought this as a replacement and I really like much better than my old fitbit. Here are the PROs: Never charge it (expected 6 month battery life), fully water proof - I shower, swim, kayak with it on and never take it off, reliable - it syncs first time every time which is breath of fresh air from my fitbit. It's easy, unobtrusive and good looking. CONS: A VERY VERY minor issue, cylinder has a sharpish edge that can scrape a little while showering if I move my hand the wrong way.
customer_reviews.author: Somebody

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after only 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Bought it July 1. Three weeks later, dead. Contacted customer service and got auto reply. It's a pretty piece of technology but hardly worth the mondy if it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: CGM

customer_reviews.title: Sleep tracking
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement. It's still my favorite for sleep tracking. Updated review. Died after 6 months. Replaced the batteries and it no long works.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Talia

customer_reviews.title: product is nice, but the app is terrible
customer_reviews.text: product is nice, but the app is terrible. Don't even use it any more. The wake alarm can only be set for everyday, so you have to manually turn it off for weekends, really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Farrah Downing

customer_reviews.title: Love my Ray
customer_reviews.text: Love my Ray! I had the Shine and wore it until it gave out after 3 years of hard use. I decided to try the Ray instead of another Shine because of the alert features. It let's me know when I have text messages, calls or calendar appts. Love it! The vibration for the alarm could be a little stronger, but that does not bother me. I highly recommend the Ray if you are looking for a sleek looking tracker that you can use for swimming also!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable. Band itself doesn’t support heart rate but you ...
customer_reviews.text: Stylish, very light to wear on, very comfortable. Band itself doesn’t support heart rate but you can use misfit app to check ur heart rate. Little pricey as it has no UI so if you care to check time or steps on the band, this band is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Pooja

customer_reviews.title: Great device, poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: Does its job, very simple. Battery is the only problem. You have to change batteries instead of other rechargeable ones and the battery needed is a specific battery which costs almost half of the price of the band.

product_meta.title: Misfit Ray - Fitness + Sleep Tracker with Black Leather Band (Carbon Black)
product_meta.description: Color:Carbon Black with Black Leather BandPerformance in its purest form. Misfit ray is our most minimal and versatile tracker. It delivers the fitness and sleep tracking you need to stay motivated, including steps taken, distance traveled, calories burned, activity tagging, and sleep duration and quality. It also never needs charging and is water-resistant to 50 meters, so it can be worn constantly. That means more data, better insights, and more powerful motivation. Ray’s clean lines create a form that is as much about fashion as it is about function. Wear it stacked with a smart Watch and cuff, or Customize it to your style - it features hidden 8-mm spring bars that allow it to be worn with almost any standard accessory, including Watch bands, bracelets, or necklaces.

Non-charging, replaceable batteries last up to 6 months
